result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin J Montgomery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Bond Terminated Slip
c: WC Jail

11:33 AM
ADA Kurczewski - present.
Attorney Ed Jelinski - present.
Defendant - present.
Stmts by the Court.
PLQ filed with the Court.
Stmts by Atty. Jelinski.
Court amends Ct. 1 to misd. 961.41(3G)(e).
NC plea entered to amended Ct. 1.
Court questions def. and advises of rights.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis for the plea contained in the probable cause section of the criminal complaint, and finds def. guilty of amended Ct.1.
Recommendations by ADA Kurczewski.
Stmts by Atty. Jelinski.
Court sentences to 1 year probation with the following conditions:
 - pay costs of the action
 - pay the buy money
 - defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent, and abide by any treatment recommendations.
 - Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Appeal rights explained to def.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
